Message to Syrian President
    Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message to Bashar al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on March 19 in connection with the riots that took place in some cities of Syria recently.
 The message bitterly condemned the vicious plots hatched by the disruptive forces to disturb the stability and security of Syria.    
 The message extended firm solidarity to the friendly government and people of Syria in their efforts to shatter all sorts of moves of the disruptive forces and consolidate the stability and patriotic unity of the country under the leadership of the president.

articles.title: DPRK SPA Delegation Returns
articles.content:
Greetings to Namibian President
    Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Sam Nujoma, president of the Republic of Namibia, on March 16 on the occasion of 14th anniversary of the independence of his country.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished him and the people of Namibia greater success in their work to defend the sovereignty of the country and achieve the peace and prosperity.
